intro: Sisymbrium islandicum, commonly known as the Canary Island mustard, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbages, and is characterized by its small, yellow flowers and pinnate leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky or coastal areas, thriving in well-drained soils. It produces pods that contain several seeds, which are dispersed by wind, contributing to its spread. Sisymbrium islandicum is also noted for its rapid growth and ability to colonize disturbed habitats.
